column4: i thought it was 172.21.13.17, but that is most likely internal

so, my ip is 138.38.227.0 and my internal network is 172.21.13.17. That would explain some problems
I can't ping the external one
bleh, emacs :P
Why doesn't something like ifconfig show my external IP? Does it not know?
and I only know from xchat as it chooses to tell me specially?
ifconfig is for your local network card and as far as it is concered, the only ip addr you have on that machine is the local one
what are the chances that my external ip will change? :P
the ip we see is the one on your router, and it really depents on your isp
my isp is a university
mine hasn't changed in a very long time, and my experince is that universitys don't change that often
also, since it sounds like your wanting to run a web server, you may want to look into dyndns or another dynamic domain service like it
actually no. I have a real one of those. I just need my ip for games and such
good deal, I usually just jump on my routers status page for that
How come the websites can't show a proper ip, like xchat can?
google for whats my ip
your isp may be running a proxie or a site cache
